GSSP Location: Požáry Section, Reporyje, Prague, Czech Republic
Reference: Episodes 1985; 8: 101-103; Geol. Series, Nat. Mus. Wales, 9, p. 90 - 100, 1989

Boundary Level: coincident with the base of the Leintwardine Formation
Correlation Events: Imprecise. May be near base of Saetograptus leintwardinensis Graptolite zone.
Reference: Lethaia 14; Episodes 1982; 5: 21-23; Geol. Series, Nat. Mus. Wales 1989; 9: 73-90

Boundary Level: coincident with the base of the Lower Elton Formation
Reference: Lethaia 14; Episodes 1982; 5: 21-23; Geol. Series, Nat. Mus. Wales 1989; 9: 73-90

Boundary Level: within upper part of the Apedale Member of the Coalbrookdale Formation
Reference: Lethaia 14; Episodes 1982; 5: 21-23; Geol. Series, Nat. Mus. Wales 1989; 9: p. 51-73

Correlation Events: Imprecise. Between the base of acritarch biozone 5 and LAD of conodont Pterospathodus amorphognathoides. The current GSSP does not coincide with the base of the Cyrtograptus centrifugus Biozone, as was supposed when the GSSP was defined. Restudy recommends a slightly higher and correlatable level on condonts - the Ireviken datum 2, which coincides approximately with the base of the murchisoni Graptolite Biozone
Reference: Lethaia 14; Episodes 1982; 5: 21-23; Geol. Series, Nat. Mus. Wales 1989; 9: p. 51-73

Correlation Events: Just above Brachiopod LAD Eocoelia intermedia and below FAD of Eocoelia curtisi
Reference: Episodes 1985; 8: 101-103; Geol. Series, Nat. Mus. Wales 1989; 9: 36-50
Episodes 1985; 8: 101-103; Geol. Series, Nat. Mus. Wales 1989; 9: 36-50

Boundary Level: 1.6m above the base of the Birkhill Shale Formation
